headline: How Investors May Respond To IBM (IBM) Earnings Beat, AI Outlook And Boardroom Shake-Up
summary: In late January 2026, IBM reported strong fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, with revenue reaching US$19,686 million for the quarter and US$67,535 million for the year, alongside robust earnings growth and an affirmed quarterly dividend of US$1.68 per share. The company also outlined expectations for more than 5% constant-currency revenue growth in 2026, while simultaneously raising significant funding through multi-currency bond issuances and adding PepsiCo CEO Ramon L. Laguarta to...

headline: IBM’s Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: IBM’s Q4 performance was marked by growth in software and infrastructure, which drove the company to surpass Wall Street’s revenue and profit expectations. Management credited the momentum to strong demand for AI- and automation-centric solutions, as well as continued adoption of its Z17 mainframe platform. CEO Arvind Krishna noted that “software grew 9%, our highest annual growth rate in history,” highlighting the impact of IBM’s focus on hybrid cloud and AI. Consulting services also contribute
